body:
Measuring and reporting the coverage of the Cython module does not appear to be working correctly in the case of this package ( https://github.com/jakirkham/cyminmax/commit/675f86170ac89891a3fd56f169fa9003eb50102c ). In particular, an error is seen when reporting the coverage and trying to submit it. This occurs on both Python 2 and Python 3. Details from the report and submission failures are included below. Links to relevant CI logs are included in the details. While the errors may initially appear to be unrelated, both issues share the same cause on local inspection. On the surface, the problem seems to share a similar cause to issue ( https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/1898 ). However this is not limited to Windows and upgrading `cython` to `0.27.1+` does not seem to affect the issue.
Coverage Report Error: ```python $ coverage report -m src/cyminmax.pyx TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable Name Stmts Miss Branch BrPart Cover Missing ------------------------------------------------------ setup.py 54 0 11 0 100% ``` xref: https://travis-ci.org/jakirkham/cyminmax/jobs/298596443#L883-L887

Coveralls Submission Error: ```python $ coveralls ... Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/travis/miniconda/envs/dplenv/bin/coveralls", line 6, in sys.exit(coveralls.wear()) File "/home/travis/miniconda/envs/dplenv/lib/python3.5/site-packages/coveralls/__init__.py", line 94, in wear source_files=coverage.coveralls(args.base_dir, ignore_errors=args.ignore_errors, merge_file=args.merge_file), File "/home/travis/miniconda/envs/dplenv/lib/python3.5/site-packages/coveralls/control.py", line 9, in coveralls return reporter.report(base_dir, ignore_errors=ignore_errors, merge_file=merge_file) File "/home/travis/miniconda/envs/dplenv/lib/python3.5/site-packages/coveralls/report.py", line 20, in report analysis = self.coverage._analyze(fr) File "/home/travis/miniconda/envs/dplenv/lib/python3.5/site-packages/coverage/control.py", line 891, in _analyze return Analysis(self.data, it) File "/home/travis/miniconda/envs/dplenv/lib/python3.5/site-packages/coverage/results.py", line 19, in __init__ self.statements = self.file_reporter.lines() File "/home/travis/miniconda/envs/dplenv/lib/python3.5/site-packages/Cython/Coverage.py", line 276, in lines return set(self._code) TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable ``` xref: https://travis-ci.org/jakirkham/cyminmax/jobs/298596443#L1003-L1018

comment_data.body: I didn't try to reproduce it with your code, but I committed a change that might fix it. Could you try latest master?

Sure. Thanks for giving it a try. Installed from [`master`]( https://github.com/cython/cython/commit/630f0124414c591315840e5ffa9c8b0df90a235b ) and ran the following using commit ( https://github.com/jakirkham/cyminmax/commit/2553a8e7f43501beb7e343f5fec7ac3712edc4f3 ) of my library.

```
$ coverage run --source . setup.py test
$ coverage report
```

The first line built it from source with all the recommended options I could find enabled. That passed. The second line failed with exit code `1` and emitted the following message. There is only one spot in the coverage codebase that matches, which points to this [block]( https://github.com/nedbat/coveragepy/blob/coverage-4.4.2/coverage/control.py#L978-L983 ).

```
Plugin 'Cython.Coverage.Plugin' did not provide a file reporter for '/Users/kirkhamj/Developer/PyCharmCE/cyminmax/src/cyminmax.pyx'.
```

Also saw some weird warnings when compiling the code. They are shown below. These are weird in the sense that I don't have a `TestClass` object at all and don't have any variables matching the names listed. That said, I doubt this is relevant to the coverage problem. Just seemed worth noting.

```
warning: TestClass:20:10: 'cpdef_method' redeclared 
warning: TestClass:31:10: 'cpdef_cname_method' redeclared 
```

Alright I think I'm starting to see what is going on. It looks like [`_find_dep_file_path`]( https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/0.27.3/Cython/Coverage.py#L33 ) is munging the paths improperly somehow. Namely it is taking paths that look like this `<dir>/src/cyminmax.pyx` and turning them into `<dir>/cyminmax.pyx` instead. This happens [inside `_parse_lines`]( https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/0.27.3/Cython/Coverage.py#L223 ). The result is paths that would have been the same [mismatch here]( https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/0.27.3/Cython/Coverage.py#L226 ) kicking out a `None` for all the files seen.

Not entirely impossible that #1900 changed the behaviour here. Suggests that we lack a test for setups like yours. See the `tests/run/coverage_*.srctree` test "archives" for an example (they are a bunch of concatenated files). Pull request welcome.

So this issue has evolved. Now reporting with Coverage yields an outright failure. ( https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/2718 ) Not sure if we should keep this open or close and migrate to that issue. Mention this specifically because some other people still see problems like this one ( e.g. https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/2265 ).

Is there at least one working repo with Cython coverage ? 

I have a single function in a [repo](https://github.com/s-sajid-ali/cython_test_coverage) to test cython coverage.  

I've followed all the directives mentioned in the [cython docs](https://cython.readthedocs.io/en/latest/src/tutorial/profiling_tutorial.html).

I have in my repo : 
- enabled line tracing in the .pyx file - [1](https://github.com/s-sajid-ali/cython_test_coverage/blob/master/cython_test_coverage/basic_cython.pyx)
- passed the relevant macro to distutils - [2](https://github.com/s-sajid-ali/cython_test_coverage/blob/master/setup.py)
- included cython.coverage in .coveragerc - [3](https://github.com/s-sajid-ali/cython_test_coverage/blob/master/.coveragerc)
- included a cython directive for the html report in .travis.yml - [4](https://github.com/s-sajid-ali/cython_test_coverage/blob/master/.travis.yml)

Yet, I don't see any coverage report for the cython source file on codecov. What am I missing ?

Explicitly asking coverage for cython report results in a failure : 
```
(intelpy3) coverage run --append --source . cython_test_coverage/basic_cython.pyx
Coverage.py warning: No data was collected. (no-data-collected)
Couldn't run 'cython_test_coverage/basic_cython.pyx' as Python code: SyntaxError: invalid syntax (basic_cython.pyx, line 3)
```

Running the same with Coverage.py from the cython repo instead (after fixing import errors) and it looks like it works but it doesn't :
```
(intelpy3) coverage run test.py                                                                                        
.                                                                                                                      
----------------------------------------------------------------------                                                 
Ran 1 test in 0.000s                                                                                                   
                                                                                                                       
OK                                                                                                                     
(intelpy3) python ~/packages/cython/Cython/Coverage.py run --append --source . cython_test_coverage/basic_cython.pyx   
(intelpy3) coverage xml                                                                                                
(intelpy3) coverage report                                                                                             
Name                               Stmts   Miss  Cover                                                                 
------------------------------------------------------                                                                 
cython_test_coverage/__init__.py       0      0   100%                                                                 
test.py                                7      0   100%                                                                 
------------------------------------------------------                                                                 
TOTAL                                  7      0   100%                                                                 
(intelpy3)                                                                                                             
```

> `coverage run --append --source . cython_test_coverage/basic_cython.pyx`

Well, if I understand correctly what the command does then this obviously can't work. `.pyx` files are not executable Python files.

> `python ~/packages/cython/Cython/Coverage.py run --append --source . cython_test_coverage/basic_cython.pyx`

`Cython/Coverage.py` is not an executable script. Running it does nothing.

> Is there at least one working repo with Cython coverage ?

See the `coverage_*.srctree` test cases here:
https://github.com/cython/cython/tree/master/tests/run

> passed the relevant macro to distutils

No, you didn't. The `setup.py` file does not get compiled, so adding compiler directives to it does not help. (And in fact, you don't want the directives to apply to `setup.py` anyway, you want to apply them to the compiled file.)

@s-sajid-ali, please don't hijack arbitrary tickets. If you have problems getting coverage reporting to work for you at all, please ask for help on the mailing list.

Apologies for posting at the wrong location, I was working on getting a basic coverage before doing the same for a larger repo and this was mentioned on that [thread](https://github.com/pyFFTW/pyFFTW/issues/235). If it was off topic or inappropriate please feel free to delete or mark it as off topic. Thanks for pointing out the cython test.

title: Cython coverage fails on trivial module
